titleStmt.title: Certaine proposals in order to a new modelling of the lawes and law-proceedings for a more speedy, cheap, and equall distribution of justice throughout the common-wealth amongst which besides others is briefly argued the great inconvenience which arises, 1. from the distinction of Courts of Common Law and Chancery, 2. by extemporary verdicts, orders, and decrees, 3. by the judges, juries, and perjurers not being lyable to make full restitution unto such as are injured by their perjury, or erroneous judgements, together with their remedies ... / by Henry Robinson.
titleStmt.author: Robinson, Henry, 1605?-1664?

titleStmt.title: Certaine proposals in order to a new modelling of the lawes and law-proceedings for a more speedy, cheap, and equall distribution of justice throughout the common-wealth amongst which besides others is briefly argued the great inconvenience which arises, 1. from the distinction of Courts of Common Law and Chancery, 2. by extemporary verdicts, orders, and decrees, 3. by the judges, juries, and perjurers not being lyable to make full restitution unto such as are injured by their perjury, or erroneous judgements, together with their remedies ... / by Henry Robinson.
